name: Development Cycle Meta-Router V1

stages.name: Request Classification
stages.description: Classify user request as bug fix, feature request, refactor, or question

decisions.description: Request is a simple code modification

stages.name: Bug Fix Pipeline
stages.description: Execute bug-fix-v1 pipeline for bug fixes

stages.name: Quick Code Change
stages.description: Handle simple, direct code modifications (1-5 lines)

stages.name: Feature Development Pipeline
stages.description: Execute feature-development-v1 pipeline for new features

stages.name: Handle Question
stages.description: Answer user questions about code or system

connections.description: Bug detected, route to bug-fix pipeline
Simple change requested, use direct code implementer
Feature requested, route to feature-development pipeline
Bug fix pipeline complete - PIPELINE ENDS
Feature development pipeline complete - PIPELINE ENDS

userContext: The user wants to understand how to remotely control the game for building reproduction scripts. They want to know the exact steps: how to open the game, what commands to run, and how to execute those commands. Provide a step-by-step tutorial with concrete examples showing: 1) How to connect to the game remotely, 2) What commands are available, 3) How to write a repro script that opens the game and runs commands automatically, 4) A working example script they can use as a template.

results.handle_question:
Excellent! Let me create a final summary for the user:

## ðŸš€ How to Get Started Right Now

### Option 1: Fastest Path (5 minutes)

```bash
# 1. Launch the game
cd /mnt/c/github/superstarships
npm run dev

# 2. Press F12 to open DevTools Console

# 3. Run the health check
fetch('tests/examples/health_check.js').then(r=>r.text()).then(eval);

# 4. Try the ship fitting example
fetch('tests/examples/ship_fitting_bug.js').then(r=>r.text()).then(eval);
```

**You'll see:**
- System health verification
- Complete bug reproduction
- Automatic evidence file download

### Option 2: Read First (15 minutes)

1. Open **`tests/QUICK_START_GUIDE.md`**
2. Follow the step-by-step instructions
3. Keep **`tests/CHEAT_SHEET.md`** open for reference

### Option 3: Deep Dive (30 minutes)

1. Read **`docs/REMOTE_GAME_CONTROL_TUTORIAL.md`**
2. Learn both browser console and WebSocket methods
3. Study all 4 complete examples

---

## ðŸŽ® What You Can Do Now

### Immediately Available (Browser Console)

âœ… **Access the game**: `window.simulator`  
âœ… **Read ship state**: Position, velocity, max speed  
âœ… **Control stations**: Dock, undock, check status  
âœ… **Manage fitting**: Fit/unfit modules, check constraints  
âœ… **Handle resources**: View inventory, add resources (cheat)  
âœ… **Run examples**: All 4 scripts ready to use  

### Quick Examples

```javascript
// Get ship info
const sim = window.simulator;
console.log("Max speed:", sim.ship.maxVelocity);
console.log("Position:", sim.ship.position);

// Dock at nearest station
const station = sim.stationManager.stations[0];
sim.stationManager.requestDock(station.id);

// Check if docked
console.log("Docked:", sim.stationManager.isDocked);

// Get inventory
const inv = sim.shipFittingManager.playerInventory;
console.log("Items:", inv.map(i => i.name));

// Add resources (cheat)
sim.resourceManager.addResource('tritanium', 1000);
```
